TopicTitle: Mission Idea: Emulating Real Life in Kerbal Space Program [WIP] [Submit a Payload] [Become a Launch or Payload Provider]

Articles.Content:
12 hours ago, Skylon said:

My station hasn't been launched yet, but I have requested that it will be

I figured he would schedule your launch first, so that when my second launch comes along, the station is there for it to launch to.

2 new satellites, <RETRACTED> and Reaas Mk1 GCS-1

submitting place entry:

its on that page

so I need 10 launches of the Reass Mk1 GCS (number refers to one launching, first one GCS-1, seventh GCS-7)

and one of the <RETRACTED> for now (<RETRACTED> as you can tell is for confidential reasons, so no peeking, PM me for more info after we have agreed on contract)

@StupidAndy, I could take the GCS series to LKO with Copper 1. Since the second stage would be landed for reuse, it would only cost 13,000 per launch, as opposed to the 27,000 posted for keeping the second stage in orbit with the payload.

Edited June 3, 2017 by 53miner53

On 5/30/2017 at 6:05 PM, icantmakemodels said:

Here's my tentative evil plan:

      0. Neon: Launches the Gravitas reusable NERV tug to LKO, possibly in parts. (We only do this once)

  1. Neon: Launches three smallish comsats in a fairing (with it's own RCS and docking port) to LKO and rendezvous with Gravitas
  2. Neon: Launches a fuel tank to rendezvous with Gravitas and refuels it. (Reusable. Might be done during launch 2)
  3. Gravitas: Hauls the comsats to literally anywhere.
  4. Gravitas: Returns to LKO
  5. PROFIT!
  6. Repeat

 

@TheEpicSquared, Can I "copyright" this so nobody else can do it?

Does anyone get the "Gravitas" reference?

 

I'll see when I get to a computer.
